text:
Edvard Ingjald Moser (; born 27 April 1962) is a Norwegian psychologist and neuroscientist. He works at the [https://www.ntnu.edu/kavli Kavli Institute for Systems Neuroscience], at the Norwegian University of Science and Technology (NTNU) in Trondheim. In 2005, he and May-Britt Moser discovered grid cells.
He won the Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine in 2014 with May-Britt Moser and John O'Keefe for their work identifying the brain's positioning system.
